Step 8: Polymorphic Relationships

View the Diff

Let‚Äôs introduce the concept of a Note. A Note can belong to a Department, an Employee, or a Team. For this, we‚Äôll need to introduce the concept of polymorphism.

id notable_id notable_type body
1 1 Employee A Sample Note!
2 1 Department Another Sample Note!
3 1 Team A Third Sample Note!

The Graphiti Stuff üé®

Digging Deeper üßê

When defining a polymorphic relationship for our API, we‚Äôre saying ‚Äúgrab all the parent records, group them by a type column, and execute different queries for each type‚Äù. This way records with notable_type == 'Employee' can hit the employees table, but records with notable_type == 'Department' could in theory load from a different API altogether.

Each of the on lines defines a new belongs_to association. That means you can customize just like always:
